TileGameClasses

Class Hand

  • java.lang.Object
    • TileGameClasses.Hand

  • public class Hand
extends java.lang.Object
    A Hand is a collection of NumberTiles. Tiles may be removed from the Hand and new tiles added to it

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Hand()
      Create a new Hand of HAND_SIZE tiles
      Hand(Hand toBeCopied)
      Create a new Hand as an exact duplicate (i.e.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Hand

        public Hand()
        Create a new Hand of HAND_SIZE tiles

      • Hand

        public Hand(Hand toBeCopied)
        Create a new Hand as an exact duplicate (i.e. a "deep copy") of another. The purpose of this is to save the starting hand to be displayed to the user after the game is over. We need to save a copy of the starting hand because it will be affected throughout the game.
        Parameters:
        toBeCopied - the Hand to be copied

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public NumberTile get(int index)
        Get the tile at a specified index in this Hand
        Parameters:
        index - the index (position) of the tile to be returned
        Returns:
        the NumberTile at the specified index

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Get the size of this Hand
        Returns:
        the number of tiles in the Hand

        public void addTile()
        Add a new tile to this Hand

      • removeTile

        public void removeTile(int index)
        Remove the tile at a specified index (position) from this Hand
        Parameters:
        index - the index (position) of the tile to be removed

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Is this Hand empty?
        Returns:
        true if this Hand is empty (contains no tiles); otherwise false

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Get a String representation of this Hand
